name: Cartage
headline: Autonomous freight coordination
description: Cartage is the future of freight coordination. Transparent, tech-driven and eliminating the need for human coordinators.
tags: industry:machine-learning; industry:workflow-automation; industry:logistics; industry:supply-chain; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Abdul Basharat, Founder
founders.description: Abdul is cofounder and CEO of Cartage. He started his career training as a military pilot.  He was the product lead for network and PLG at Rose Rocket (YC S16 trucking ERP) and helped Pathstream launch a B2B platform from 0-1. Prior to tech he worked in management consulting.

founders.name: Josh Lampen, Founder
founders.description: Josh is cofounder and CTO of Cartage. At Rose Rocket (YC S16 trucking ERP), he was a founding engineer on their Platform team, where he led the development of their first workflow engine. He was also an engineer at Together (YC S19). Prior to tech, Josh was a management consultant, and played water polo for Canada's National Team.

founders.name: Harman Sahota, Founder
founders.description: Harman is cofounder and COO of Cartage. He has previously built two logistics companies. The first led to a 500K contract with Sherwin Williams at age 16, and the second, Westcore Logistics, was Canada's fastest growing logistics company in 2023. In four years Harman scaled Westcore from 0-50M Revenue with only 4 FTE, while maintaining 4x industry profit margins.

FAQ
## Frequently asked questions
## Frequently asked questions
What is Cartage?
Cartage is an AI-managed logistics service for manufacterers and distributers. Unlike a traditional freight brokerage (3PL) or managed transportation provider (4PL), Cartage combines AI automation and human logistics experts to manage the entire logistics function on behalf of its customers. Powered by our AI logistics coordinator, Wilson, we function as your dedicated internal logistics team, managing everything from carrier procurement to delivery directly with carriers. Backed by our experienced operations team, we ensure every high-priority task is handled with precision and urgency.
How much does it cost?
Do I still need to be actively involved in logistics?
What’s the value if I already use direct carriers?
Do I need special software to use Cartage?
How does onboarding work?
Can I try Cartage to know if it works for my business?
Get started

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Cartage**

**Mission**: Cartage is fundamentally reshaping freight coordination with the vision of creating a future where logistics runs autonomously, leaving human coordinators behind. They’re all about transparency and leveraging technology to streamline logistics processes.

**Founding and Team**: Founded in 2023 and part of Y Combinator Batch S24, Cartage operates from the tech hub of San Francisco. The company is small but agile, boasting a team of just 8 employees, bringing a mix of innovation and expertise to the logistics space. They have experienced backing, including Tom Blomfield as a group partner.

**Unique Selling Proposition**: At the core of Cartage's offer is “Wilson,” an AI logistics coordinator crafted to handle various logistics functions, from procurement to payment, without the usual administrative burden. They claim to nearly eliminate the need for phone calls and emails, bringing efficiency with a staggering 97% workflow automation. This level of automation can lead to cost savings of approximately 18%, as it directly accesses carrier rates and bypasses traditional brokerage fees.

**Services**:
- **For Shippers**: They manage the entire logistics function for manufacturers and distributors, promising to take the hassle out of freight coordination.
